lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/com.gpt.dumpgpt.Duke.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run com.gpt.dumpgpt.Duke.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
private final static Scanner SCANNER = new Scanner(System.in);
private final static HashMap<String, Function<Command, Void>> COMMANDS = new HashMap<>();
printWrapped("Failed to mark task as done...");
printWrapped("Failed to mark task as done...");
"Nice I've marked this task as done:",
printWrapped("Failed to mark task as undone...");
printWrapped("Failed to mark task as undone...");
"OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:",
printWrapped("Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");
private final HashMap<String, String> OPTIONS = new HashMap<>();
private void addOption(String key, ArrayList<String> tokens) {
private final HashMap<String, Object> STATES = new HashMap<>();
public void setStateObject(String key, Object state) {
public Event(String name, String from, String to) {
return String.format("[E]%s (from: %s | to: %s)", super.toString(), this.from, this.to);
return super.isValid() && from != null && !from.isBlank() && to != null && !to.isBlank();
event an event working     /from A /to Z

# run the program, feed commands from input.txt file and redirect the output to the ACTUAL.TXT
